A camera instance can be used to compute 3D transformations and generate a matrix that can be applied, for instance, on a Canvas. More...

Detailed Description

A camera instance can be used to compute 3D transformations and generate a matrix that can be applied, for instance, on a Canvas. 

   // 3D rotate
   paint.setARGB(60, 0, 0, 255);
   camera.save();
   camera.translate(200, -650, 0);
   camera.rotate(20, 0, -20);
   paint.setAntiAlias(true);
   for (int32_t i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
       canvas.save();
       camera.rotate(0, 18, 0);
       camera.getMatrix(matrix);
       canvas.concat(*matrix);
       canvas.drawRect(0, 0, 120, 120, paint);
       canvas.restore();
   }
   camera.restore();

Definition at line 36 of file Camera.h.

Sets the location of the camera.

The default location is set at 0, 0, -8.
